annotation.value: \Abst{A general result establishing complete convergence for the row sums of an array of rowwise negatively dependent random variables is presented. From this result, a number of complete convergence results have been obtained for weighted sums of negatively dependent random variables.}

text.value: \KWE{complete convergence; negatively dependent; weighted sums; arrays}
COMPLETE CONVERGENCE FOR ARRAYS OF NEGATIVELY DEPENDENT RANDOM VARIABLES
Complete convergence for arrays of negatively dependent random variables
H. Sung, K. Budsaba, and A. Volodin
Department of Applied Mathematics, Pai Chai University, Taejon, South Korea, sungsh@pcu.ac.kr
Center of Excellence in Mathematics, CHE, Bangkok, Thailand; Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Thammasat University Rangsit Center, Pathumthani, Thailand, kamon@mathstat.sci.tu.ac.th
School of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Western Australia, Crawley, Australia; University of Regina, Canada,
The concept of complete convergence of a sequence of random variables was introduced by Hsu and Robbins
of random variables converges completely to the constant

converges completely to zero. The paper
initiated numerous explorations of the complete convergence of sums of independent random variables. The research was continued by Erd

extended the result of Hsu--Robbins--Katz to the case where
is an array of rowwise independent random variables which are stochastically dominated by a random variable$X$satisfying

Recently, some complete convergence theorems for negatively dependent random variables have been obtained by many authors (see, for example,
and references in these papers). Taylor
to the array of rowwise negatively dependent random variables. Giuliano
considered so-called acceptable random variable, which is more general notion than negative dependency. The finite set of random variables
is said to be negatively dependent if every finite subset of the sequence

is negatively dependent. In this paper, a general result establishing complete convergence for the row sums of an array of rowwise negatively dependent random variables is presented. It also specifies the corresponding rate of convergence. From this result, a number of complete convergence
results for negatively dependent random variables have been obtained. As a corollary, the result of Taylor
is obtained. Throughout this paper,$C$denotes a positive constant which may be different in various places, and it is convenient to define
To prove the main result, the following lemmas are necessary. The first two lemmas are well known and can be found, for example, in

is a sequence of negatively dependent random variables.
The second lemma mainly states that negatively dependent random variables are negatively correlated.

Х. Санг$^1$, К. Будсаба$^2$, А. Володин$^3$

annotation.value: \Abst{Приводится результат о полной сходимости для сумм в схеме серий для отрицательно зависимых случайных величин в весьма общей форме. Из этого результата следуют многие факты о полной сходимости взвешенных сумм отрицательно зависимых случайных величин.}

text.value: \KW{полная сходимость; отрицательная зависимость; взвешенные суммы; схема серий}
